definition: hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: Just then the Mullah heard the sound of his donkey's feet.
sentences.chinese: 就在那时，毛拉听到驴子的蹄声。

sentences.english: Can anybody ask mulla families to cut down on marriages & children ?
sentences.chinese: 有人能叫毛拉少结婚少生孩子吗？

sentences.english: The prayers finished and the Mullah stood to offer a khutbah, the speech for the Jummah prayer.
sentences.chinese: 祈祷结束之后，毛拉站起来为祈祷者讲道。

sentences.english: The mullahs turned up and offered plenty of pro-natalist rhetoric.
sentences.chinese: 毛拉们态度转变并准备了许多抵制生育的说词。

sentences.english: Just then the Mullah heard the sound of his donkey's feet. He looked around.
sentences.chinese: 就在那时，毛拉听到驴子的蹄声。

sentences.english: It is not just the 'mulla families' that reproduce in large numbers in India.
sentences.chinese: 印度并非只有毛拉才生一大堆孩子。

sentences.english: Barack Hussein Obama would present another challenge for Iran's mullahs .
sentences.chinese: 巴拉克侯赛因奥巴马，伊朗毛拉们的又一威胁。

sentences.english: First, only the mullahs and militant commanders would command respect.
sentences.chinese: 当初，只有毛拉和好战分子指挥官们才能得到尊重。

sentences.english: The flowers are based on the pink mulla mulla .
sentences.chinese: 该花的依据是粉红色的毛拉毛拉。

sentences.english: The flowers are based on the pink mulla mulla .
sentences.chinese: 该花的依据是粉红色的毛拉毛拉。

definition: Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God/also written 穆罕默德
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Suleiman (name)/General Michel Suleiman (1948-), Lebanese military man and politician, president of Lebanon 2008-2014
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Anwar (name)/Anwar bin Ibrahim (1947-), Malaysian politician, deputy prime minister 1993-1998, imprisoned 1999-2004 on charges including alleged homosexual acts, subsequently overturned
Nasr or Nasser (Arab name)/Gamal Abdel Nasser (1918-1970), Egyptian President
